comments:
I20040609 1200

I got a failure yesterday while doing an open type (Ctrl+Shift+T). The stack
shows that a long running operation (classpath initialization) is happening in
the UI thread without any form of progress.  An unhappy side-effect (apart from
lack of progress), is that this has a danger of OperationCanceledException being
thrown in the UI thread, which is eventually reported to the user as an error
(see bug 66436).  Platform UI may end up handling cancelation, but it still
looks dangerous for this long running work to be happening without some form of
runnable context. Here is the stack:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Jun 09, 2004 17:48:57.999
!MESSAGE The command for the key you pressed failed
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)

JDT/UI calls SearchEngine.createWorkspaceScope which doesn't allow passing in 
a runnable context or a progress monitor. 

Moving to JDT/Core.
